CosmoWAP
  • Best-Fit Bias
  • View page source

Best-Fit Bias

Compute systematic bias on parameters from neglecting contributions in the model.

Method

FullForecast.best_fit_bias(param, bias_term, terms='NPP', pkln=None, bkln=None, verbose=True, sigma=None)

Compute parameter bias from neglecting a contribution.

Parameters:

  • param – Parameter(s) to compute bias for (string or list)

  • bias_term – Neglected term(s) (e.g., 'WS', 'GR1')

  • terms (str) – Base terms (default: 'NPP')

  • pkln (list) – Pk multipoles

  • bkln (list) – Bk multipoles

  • verbose (bool) – Show progress

  • sigma (float) – FoG damping

Returns:

Tuple of (bias_dict, fisher_diagonal)

Usage

import cosmo_wap as cw
from cosmo_wap.lib import utils
from cosmo_wap.forecast import FullForecast

cosmo = utils.get_cosmo(h=0.67, Omega_m=0.31)
survey = cw.SurveyParams.Euclid(cosmo)
cosmo_funcs = cw.ClassWAP(cosmo, survey)
forecast = FullForecast(cosmo_funcs, kmax_func=0.15, N_bins=4)

# Bias from neglecting wide-separation
bias, fisher = forecast.best_fit_bias(
    ["A_s", "n_s", "h"],
    bias_term="WS",
    terms="NPP",
    pkln=[0, 2]
)

for param in ["A_s", "n_s", "h"]:
    print(f"Bias on {param}: {bias[param]:.4e}")

# Bias from neglecting GR effects
bias_gr, _ = forecast.best_fit_bias(
    ["A_s", "n_s"],
    bias_term="GR1",
    terms="NPP",
    pkln=[0, 2]
)

Alternative: Via get_fish

Bias can also be computed alongside Fisher matrix:

fisher = forecast.get_fish(
    ["A_s", "n_s"],
    terms="NPP",
    pkln=[0, 2],
    bias_list="WS"
)

# Access via fisher.bias
print(fisher.bias)
